# Today's Best Bluetooth Speakers, According to Our Music-Obsessed Editors

And luckily, there's a Bluetooth speaker for every taste and budget.

![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

By [Stefan Vazharov](/author/14282/stefan-vazharov/)

Updated:  Oct 22, 2019

Ain't nothing better these days than sitting on the couch, smartphone by your
side, Spotify playlist streaming from a booming, professional-grade speaker
sans wires.

That's just one reason you'll want to invest in a high-quality bluetooth
speaker. But there's a lot out there, and you don't want to drop some change
and end up with a muffled, staticky speaker.  

So we spent hundreds of hours researching and testing the top bluetooth
speakers on the market today to find you the absolute best.

### The Best Bluetooth Speakers at a Glance

  *  **Best Overall:** [Marshall Stockwell II Portable Bluetooth Speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q12WDP2?linkCode=ogi)
  *  **Runner-Up:** [Soundcore Motion+ Bluetooth Speaker by Anker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P39MLKH?linkCode=ogi)
  *  **The Thrifty Shopper's Pick:** [Soundcore Flare Bluetooth Speaker by Anker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07BHP4W36?linkCode=ogi)
  *  **The Waterproof Pick:** [Ultimate Ears Boom 3 Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07DD7ZJ6X?linkCode=ogi)
  *  **The Ultra-Compact Pick:** [JBL Clip 3 Bluetooth Speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q8SZLMB?linkCode=ogi)
  *  **The Smart Pick:** [Bose Portable Home Speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VFKBQ3G?linkCode=ogi)
  *  **The Sustainably Crafted Pick:** [House of Marley No Bounds XL Bluetooth Speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07C7SQ3KN?linkCode=ogi)
  *  **The Party-Loving Pick:** [Sony SRS-XB32 Portable Bluetooth Speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P63D5B8?linkCode=ogi)

### Here's a Look at Our Testing Process:  

![testing criteria: hours in-house
testing](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

Hours Hand-Tested

400+

![testing criteria: number of products
tested](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

Products Tested In-House

8

![testing criteria: number of people who worked on this
piece](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

Editors Helped Put This Review Together

8

Our team spent more than 400 hours researching and testing today’s finest
Bluetooth speakers from the likes of Bose, Soundcore, Marshall, and more.

When it comes to shopping for a Bluetooth speaker, the most important things
to consider are sound quality, battery life, and, of course, design. We
weighed all this criteria when testing speakers, along with how easy the
speaker was to pair, additional features the speakers offered, and even a
user's ability to customize the sound experience.  

Additional features, such as a waterproof body and wireless connectivity
options that go beyond Bluetooth, are becoming increasingly popular, too. The
latest offerings on the market will even let you access your favorite virtual
assistants by Google and Amazon.

Our Testing Process

[ ![](https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/how-we-
tested-1586186764.gif?crop=1xw:0.8887876025524157xh;center,top&resize=300:*)
The In-Depth Method We Use to Review Products ](/lifestyle/a29196296/how-we-
test-products/)

Now that you're armed with all the information you need to pick out a
bluetooth speaker, take a look at our favorites to find the best wireless
speaker for you.

## Best Overall

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q12WDP2?linkCode=ogi)

Marshall Stockwell II Portable Bluetooth Speaker

amazon.com

$169.00

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q12WDP2?linkCode=ogi)

**Product Highlights**

  * Three audio drivers in Blumlein stereo setup
  * Up to 20 hours of battery life, fast-charging capable via USB-C port
  * IPX4 water-resistant
  * Bluetooth 5.0 connectivity
  * Weight: 3 pounds

With its timelessly cool design, impressive sound, portability and top-notch
battery life, the Marshall Stockwell II is our top Bluetooth speaker today. It
has a neat carrying strap, as well as a durable build with IPX4 rating for
water resistance.

The design of the Stockwell II has been inspired by the brand’s iconic guitar
amps. In addition to the legendary Marshall logo on the front speaker grille,
the device’s dedicated knobs for controlling the volume, bass, and treble
output make it look more like an amp than a speaker.

Marshall also partnered with Blumlein Stereo to give the speaker the ability
to deliver an immersive, multi-directional sound that's well-balanced and
incredibly easy to customize via the rotating knobs I mentioned above.
According to Tim Gideon from
_[PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/review/368077/marshall-stockwell-ii)_ , the
speaker “sounds fantastic.” He also noted that, thanks to the handy bass and
treble controls, “you can dial in pretty much any sound signature you like.”

#### What Our In-House Testers Thought

![Scott
Simone](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

MANAGING EDITOR

Scott Simone

“Big sound comes from this small speaker. The crisp, clear audio can envelope
a room of any size. What’s more, I listen to a pretty eclectic range of music
— think jazzy tunes from Ella Fitzgerald to throaty rifts from the likes of
Queens of the Stone Age — and they all sound impeccable on this speaker.”

![Stefan Vazharov: Tech
Editor](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

Senior Tech Editor

Stefan Vazharov

"I like the device’s built-in battery indicator, as well as the USB-C
connector it uses for charging. The quick-charging capabilities are also handy
— you can get up to 6 hours’ worth of audio playback after only 20 minutes."

![Zarah
Kavarana](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7)

ASSOCIATE EDITOR

Zarah Kavarana

"I particularly like that it provides omnidirectional sound, so no matter
where you place it, music doesn’t sound muffled. I also really enjoy the ease
of turning the rotating knobs up top to control sound, bass, and treble. It
allows for a more customizable sound experience because you can adjust the
levels to your liking.”

If you like the Stockwell II speaker as much as we do but need even more
decibels, consider the larger and pricier [Marshall
Tufton](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07QJD5MT4?linkCode=ogi) instead. It has
similar design and even more impressive sound quality.

## Runner-Up

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P39MLKH?linkCode=ogi)

Soundcore Motion+ Bluetooth Speaker

amazon.com

$99.99

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P39MLKH?linkCode=ogi)

### Product Highlights

  * Dual tweeters, woofers, and passive radiators, Qualcomm aptX and Hi-Res Audio compatible
  * Up to 12 hours of battery life, USB-C connector for charging
  * IPX7 waterproof
  * Bluetooth 5.0 connectivity
  * Weight: 2.3 pounds

The Soundcore Motion+ by Anker is a solid runner-up, as well as the best
Bluetooth speaker $100 can buy. It has an understated design, intuitive
controls, audio performance that’s worthy of a much higher price tag, and
solid battery life. The gadget is also fully waterproof, meaning that you can
take it anywhere with you. A
[TechRadar](https://www.techradar.com/reviews/anker-soundcore-motion-portable-
bluetooth-speaker) editor noted that the product “has almost everything you
could want at an appealing price point.”

I was blown away by the sound quality of the Soundcore Motion+. Equipped with
a multitude of audio drivers, it delivered a consistently great sound across
the entire frequency range during my testing. Unlike its similarly priced
competitors, the speaker remained distortion-free, even at high volume levels.
Rather impressively, the speaker is even capable of streaming Hi-Res Audio
content!

You can tweak the equalizer settings of the speaker to your exact liking via a
mobile app. The Motion+ has a dedicated button for instantly enhancing the
bass. In case _that’s_ not enough, you can pair two Motion+ speakers in a true
stereo setup.

I like that Anker has equipped the speaker with a USB-C port for charging.
Anker backs the product by a robust 18-month warranty.

## A Compact and Interactive Speaker

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07BHP4W36?linkCode=ogi)

Soundcore Flare Bluetooth Speaker

amazon.com

$64.00

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07BHP4W36?linkCode=ogi)

### **Product Highlights**  

  * Dual audio drivers with passive bass radiators
  * Up to 12 hours of battery life, microUSB port for charging
  * IPX7 waterproof rating
  * Bluetooth 4.2 connectivity
  * Weight: 1.1 pounds

The fabric-covered, waterproof Soundcore Flare by Anker successfully combines
an attractive design, intuitive controls, excellent audio quality, and great
battery life. With customizable LED lights, the Soundcore Flare is also
incredibly interactive for its price point. A
[TechRadar](https://www.techradar.com/reviews/anker-soundcore-flare) editor
has also noted that the product is "an amazing value in the sub-$100 wireless
speaker segment."

With a pair of high-quality audio drivers and a duo of passive bass radiators
on board, the Soundcore Flare speaker sounds a lot better than its price tag
suggests. Users can tweak the device’s audio settings via a mobile app.
There’s also the option to pair two speakers for a full stereo experience.

The speaker has an IPX7 waterproof rating, which means that it can survive
full submersion under water. The device can deliver up to 12 hours of audio
playback between charges. You can order the gadget with a gray or blue fabric
finish.  

Our team member [Kayla
Ramsey](https://www.bestproducts.com/author/17359/kayla-ramsey/) loved the
charcoal fabric finish, and told me it makes the Soundcore Flare speaker look
“more expensive than it is.” She found the lighting ring at the bottom of the
device to be a really cool feature, and she said it set it apart from other
speakers.

Kayla praised the audio quality of the Soundcore Flare, referring to it as
“great for such a small speaker.” She found the speaker’s battery sufficient
for two evenings of wireless tunes — in line with Anker’s claims.

She also found that the option to pair it with another Soundcore Flare was
cool, but not exactly necessary — given that the speaker fully filled the
apartment with sound without needing an additional unit.

##  **The Best Waterproof Speaker**

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07DD7ZJ6X?linkCode=ogi)

Ultimate Ears BOOM 3 Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker

amazon.com

$139.00

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07DD7ZJ6X?linkCode=ogi)

### Product Highlights

  * Dual audio drivers and passive radiators
  * Up to 15 hours of battery life, microUSB port for charging
  * IP67 waterproof
  * 2-year warranty
  * Weight: 1.3 pounds

The all-new BOOM 3 by Ultimate Ears is the best waterproof speaker available
today. It has a beautiful design and finish, amazing 360-degree sound, top-
notch battery life (up to 15 hours), and a host of neat features you can
access via a smartphone app.

The device's app-enabled features include the ability to access your favorite
Apple Music playlists with a single touch, as well as the option to connect
over 150 BOOM speakers for a bigger sound experience. Surprisingly, Ultimate
Ears has decided to skip support for one-touch access to Spotify playlists.

The speaker is fully waterproof with an IP67 rating. This means that you can
fully submerge it underwater. We also like that Ultimate Ears designed the
BOOM 3 to float in water, making it perfect for pool parties.

There are three colors to pick from — black, blue, and red. In case you find
the BOOM 3 too small, consider the larger [MEGABOOM 3
speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07DD3W154?linkCode=ogi) instead. It has a
similar design, but a more compact body.  

Our team member Bridget Clegg thoroughly tested the UE Boom 3 wireless
speaker. She was pleasantly surprised by the gadget’s design and
craftsmanship, especially the Ultraviolet Purple color finish of its fabric.
Unsurprisingly, Clegg liked the “satisfyingly large” buttons of the speaker,
as well as its fully waterproof body.

Clegg noted that the sound signature of the UE Boom 3 is “well-balanced and
crisp” for “both music and podcasts.” She was also happy to discover that the
speaker’s battery life during her testing matched the manufacturer’s claim of
15 hours between charges. Overall, she found the speaker to be a good buy,
thanks to its waterproof design, easy setup, and a great selection of
available features.

My colleague [Brandon
Carte](https://www.bestproducts.com/author/17442/brandon-carte/) liked the
Boom 3 speaker a lot as well. He praised its "extremely loud, crystal clear
audio" in a compact, travel-friendly, and waterproof form factor. He purchased
five additional ones - one for himself to enjoy bigger sound, and four to give
family and friends.

## The Ultra-Compact Pick

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q8SZLMB?linkCode=ogi)

JBL Clip 3 Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker

amazon.com

$69.95

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07Q8SZLMB?linkCode=ogi)

### Product Highlights

  * 40-millimeter audio transducer
  * Up to 10 hours of battery life, microUSB port for charging
  * IPX7 waterproof
  * Bluetooth 4.1 connectivity
  * Weight: 0.49 pounds

The JBL Clip 3 is our favorite micro Bluetooth speaker. It offers a great
blend of an elegant and colorful design, a surprisingly powerful audio
experience, a fully waterproof body, and up to a really impressive 10 hours of
battery life at an affordable price.

We really like that, for the first time, the signature metal carabiner of the
JBL Clip series of compact speakers is available in colors that match their
fabric finish. The latter is available in 11 color options, which is a
remarkable feat for a product in this price point.

Powered by a single 40-millimeter audio driver, the JBL Clip 3 sounds a lot
bigger than its palm-sized form factor suggests. The gadget is also an
impressive performer when used as a speakerphone.

According to [_CNET_](https://www.cnet.com/reviews/jbl-clip-3-review/), "the
JBL Clip 3 offers improved sound and battery life in a more durable design
than its predecessor." CNET's executive editor David Carnoy also gave the
device high marks for its design and quality sound for its small size.

My colleague [Melanie Yates](https://www.bestproducts.com/author/5243/melanie-
yates/) spent time using the JBL Clip 3 wireless speaker. She liked the
lightweight, colorful design of the micro speaker and its built-in carabiner —
she hung it on a towel hook in her kitchen and seamlessly enjoyed its wireless
tunes.

The sound quality of the JBL Clip 3 impressed Melanie. She found the tiny
gadget to deliver a better audio experience and “broader sound” than a pricier
smart home speaker with a virtual assistant on board. Yates observed the
battery life of the JBL Clip 3 to be in line with the manufacturer’s claims.

Our contributing editor Sanah Faroke praised the JBL Clip 3 for being "louder
than it looks." She also liked the portable size of the speaker, as well as
its built-in clip for attaching it to a bag or a backpack.

##  The Smart Pick

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VFKBQ3G?linkCode=ogi)

Bose Portable Home Speaker

amazon.com

$349.00

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VFKBQ3G?linkCode=ogi)

### Product Highlights

  * High-excursion transducer with three passive radiators
  * Up to 12 hours of battery life, USB-C connector for charging
  * IPX4 rating for water resistance
  * Bluetooth, Wi-Fi connectivity, Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple AirPlay 2 compatible
  * Weight: 2.3 pounds

The all-new Bose Portable Home Speaker is smarter and more feature-packed than
any other entry on this list. When not in use on the go, the gadget doubles as
an excellent smart home speaker, courtesy of built-in Wi-Fi connectivity. It
is compatible with Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant, and Apple AirPlay 2
wireless playback.

The Portable Home Speaker has the same cool design and water-resistant build
as the [Bose SoundLink+ Revolve Bluetooth
speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06XCW4VFS?linkCode=ogi). I really like
that the newcomer has kept the fabric handle, which made the SoundLink+
Revolve one of my favorites. Bose offers the product in silver or black.

I wasn’t surprised to discover that the 360-degree sound of the Portable Home
Speaker is rich and entertaining, just as you would expect from a Bose
offering. Tim Gideon from [_PCMag_](https://www.pcmag.com/review/371062/bose-
portable-home-speaker) also observed that the device “delivers impressive
power for its size.” I really enjoyed the grin-inducing bass which,
thankfully, didn’t come at the expense of the high- and the mid-range most of
the time.

The built-in microphones of the device picked up my voice commands even with
the volume up. There is a button for disabling them in case you want to take a
break from Alexa or the Google Assistant.

The speaker’s battery life is good, especially considering how feature-packed
it is. I tip my hat to Bose for equipping it with a USB-C connector for
charging. The industry giant also offers an [optional charging
dock](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07WWKCS7R?linkCode=ogi), which is incredibly
convenient for home use. I believe it’s well worth its $29 price tag.

## The Sustainably Crafted Pick

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07C7SQ3KN?linkCode=ogi)

House of Marley No Bounds XL Bluetooth Speaker

House of Marley amazon.com

$149.99

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07C7SQ3KN?linkCode=ogi)

### Product Highlights

  * Up to 16 hours of battery life, microUSB port for charging
  * IP67 waterproof
  * 2-year warranty
  * Weight: 3.7 pounds

The coolest thing about the House of Marley No Bounds XL wireless speaker is
its waterproof, environmentally friendly build. The materials used in the
making of the stylish speaker include sustainably harvested cork, recycled
plastics, and reclaimed hemp. The aluminum used in the making of the device is
naturally easily recyclable, too. We really like that, in addition to looking
cool, the cork used in the making of the speaker allows it to float in water.

The sound of the speaker is excellent for its price point. Like all House of
Marley products, the No Bounds XL wireless speaker a well-balanced audio
experience with just the right amount of bass on a consistent basis. If you
want, you can wirelessly pair two No Bounds XL speakers for a bigger sonic
experience.

You can expect up to 16 hours of use between charges from the speaker. It’s
great that, if necessary, you can use the device to power up other gadgets.
The trick works because the No Bounds XL wireless speaker has a built-in USB
port.

Tim Gideon from _[PCMag](https://www.pcmag.com/review/364373/house-of-marley-
no-bounds-xl)_ liked the waterproof design and the bass-heavy sound of the
House of Marley No Bounds XL. He did however, note that its speakerphone
feature could be better.

Our editor [Adam Mansuroglu](https://www.bestproducts.com/author/15788/adam-
mansuroglu/) tested the House of Marley No Bounds XL wireless speaker. He
liked the “minimalist design” of the speaker, though he noted that its power
button is a tad challenging to locate. He described the sound quality of the
device as amazing after listening to various music styles.

According to Mansuroglu, the battery life of the House of Marley No Bounds XL
lived up to the manufacturer’s claims. He observed that setting up access to
Amazon Alexa on the speaker is a quick process.  

##  **The Party-Loving Pick**

[ ](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P63D5B8?linkCode=ogi)

Sony SRS-XB32 Extra Bass Bluetooth Speaker

amazon.com

[SHOP NOW](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P63D5B8?linkCode=ogi)

### Product Highlights

  * Dual 48-millimeter audio drivers
  * Up to 24 hours of battery life, microUSB port for charging
  * IP67 waterproof, shockproof, dustproof
  * Built-in line and strobe lights
  * Weight: 2 p0unds

Sony’s SRS-XB32 Bluetooth speaker packs a ton of cool features, which make it
one of the best entries in its price range. Some standouts include a fully
waterproof design, a rugged body, built-in line and strobe lights, and a
robust battery life. There are three cool colors to pick from — black, blue,
and gray.

The speaker packs two 48-millimeter audio drivers, which combine to deliver
excellent audio quality. Tim Gideon from
[_PCMag_](https://www.pcmag.com/review/368591/sony-srs-xb32) also observed
that the device offers "a strong listening experience" for its price point.
There’s an option to choose between extra-bass or live-sound modes, as well as
to seamlessly connect multiple SRS-XB32 speakers together.  

I really like that the Sony SRS-XB32 can charge your gadgets, thanks to a
built-in USB port. The feature sets the product apart from its competitors.
